se350.elevatorSim.build

Class FloorManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • se350.elevatorSim.build.FloorManager

  • public class FloorManager
extends java.lang.Object
    A Singleton facade that handles everything to do with Floors, including adding people and removing people from them and getting their size. This class is a singleton, but must be initialized using the initialize(int numOfFloors) method. This can only be called once.
    Author:
    Shahzaib Syed

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public static void initialize(int numOfFloors)
        Creates the floor manager, can only be called once.
        Parameters:
        numOfFloors - is the number of floors the building has.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this method has already been called once elsewhere

      • destroy

        public static void destroy()
        Used for testing building creation.

      • getInstance

        public static FloorManager getInstance()
        Static method that returns a reference to the only FloorManager instance.
        Returns:
        The Singleton instance of FloorManager
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if initialize is not called once before invoking getInstance()

        Adds a Person instance to a specific floor.
        Parameters:

        person - - The person you are adding to the floor

      • addPeopleToElevator

        public void addPeopleToElevator(int story,
                       Elevator e)
                         throws InvalidParameterException
        Adds people from the specified floor to the specified elevator.
        Parameters:
        story - - The story that the elevator arrived at
        e - - The elevator to add people to
        Throws:
        InvalidParameterException - - if the story is not a valid story

        direction - - The direction the person wants to go
